name: Spinach Artichoke Gnocchi
description: These creamy spinach artichoke gnocchi make such a great weeknight meal. The dish is vegan, very easy to make, and ready in just 15 minutes!
recipeIngredient: one  package store-bought vegan gnocchi  ((17.6 oz))
2 teaspoons yellow or white miso paste
1 teaspoon tapioca starch (or corn starch if you can't find tapioca starch)
1 cup unsweetened almond or soy milk

recipeInstructions.text: Make the sauce: Place all ingredients in a high speed blender and process until smooth. This should take about 30 seconds to a minute. I didn't soak the cashews, but if you want to make things easier for your blender, you could soak them in hot water for 30 minutes or even overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the sauce: Place all ingredients in a high speed blender and process until smooth. This should take about 30 seconds to a minute. I didn't soak the cashews, but if you want to make things easier for your blender, you could soak them in hot water for 30 minutes or even overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the gnocchi according to the instructions on the package. Drain and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the gnocchi according to the instructions on the package. Drain and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the creamy cashew sauce into a pan and heat on medium heat for about 2 minutes. It will thicken up considerably.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the creamy cashew sauce into a pan and heat on medium heat for about 2 minutes. It will thicken up considerably.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked gnocchi, the spinach, and the artichoke hearts and cook for another 2 minutes until the spinach has wilted.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked gnocchi, the spinach, and the artichoke hearts and cook for another 2 minutes until the spinach has wilted.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley and red pepper flakes and serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley and red pepper flakes and serve immediately.
